templates.title: Infection Prevention and Control (IPC) Audit Tool
templates.description: A comprehensive monthly audit tool to ensure compliance with the Health and Social Care Act 2008: Code of Practice on the prevention and control of infections. Covers environment, hand hygiene, PPE, and waste management.

sections.title: 1. General Environment & Cleanliness
items: Are all areas of the home visibly clean, dust-free, and free from clutter?
Are floors, walls, and ceilings in good repair and easy to clean (impervious surfaces)?
Is lighting adequate in all areas to allow for effective cleaning and inspection?
Are radiators and pipework covered and clean to prevent dust accumulation and burn risks?
Are furniture and soft furnishings (chairs, curtains) clean, intact, and made of wipeable materials where appropriate?

sections.title: 2. Hand Hygiene Facilities
items: Are dedicated hand wash basins available in all clinical areas, sluice rooms, and kitchens?
Is liquid soap available at all hand wash basins (wall-mounted dispensers)?
Are paper towels available in wall-mounted dispensers at all hand wash basins?
Are foot-operated waste bins provided for paper towel disposal?
Are hand hygiene posters displayed at all hand wash stations?

sections.title: 3. Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
items: Is a sufficient supply of disposable aprons and gloves available in all care areas?
Are PPE dispensers clean, stocked, and accessible?
Are staff observed using PPE correctly (donning and doffing procedures)?
Is eye protection and fluid-repellent masks available for procedures with splash risk?

sections.title: 4. Waste Management
items: Are waste bins colour-coded correctly (e.g., clinical, domestic, recycling)?
Are sharps bins assembled correctly, not overfilled (below fill line), and signed/dated?
Is the external waste storage area secure, clean, and pest-free?
Are waste transfer notes retained and up-to-date?

sections.title: 5. Laundry & Linen Management
items: Is infected/soiled linen segregated into water-soluble (red) bags at the point of generation?
Is clean linen stored in a dedicated, clean, dry area off the floor?
Does the laundry room have a dirty-to-clean flow to prevent cross-contamination?
Are staff handling linen wearing appropriate PPE?

templates.scoring: Yes = 1, No = 0. Total Score / Total Applicable Items * 100 = Compliance %

templates.title: Medication Management & Administration Audit
templates.description: A detailed audit to verify safe management of medicines in line with NICE guidelines (SC1) and CQC Regulation 12. Covers storage, administration, records (MAR charts), and controlled drugs.

sections.title: 1. Storage & Security
items: Is the medication room/cupboard locked when not in use?
Is the medication fridge temperature recorded daily (range 2-8Â°C)?
Are Controlled Drugs (CDs) stored in a compliant CD cabinet?
Are keys kept securely by authorised staff only?
Are open dates recorded on liquids, creams, and eye drops?

sections.title: 2. Administration Records (MAR Charts)
items: Is there a photograph of the resident on the MAR chart?
Are allergies clearly recorded (or 'No Known Allergies' stated)?
Are all doses signed for immediately after administration?
Are codes used correctly for non-administration (e.g., refused, hospitalised)?
Are handwritten entries signed and witnessed by a second staff member?

sections.title: 3. Controlled Drugs (CDs)
items: Is the CD register accurate and up-to-date?
Are CD balances checked and recorded at shift handovers?
Are two signatures present for all CD administration and receipt?
Is the disposal of CDs witnessed and recorded correctly?

sections.title: 4. Staff Competency
items: Have all staff administering medication completed annual competency assessments?
Is there a list of staff authorised to administer medication?
Are staff aware of the procedure for reporting medication errors?

templates.title: Person-Centred Care Plan Audit
templates.description: Ensures care plans are personalised, up-to-date, and compliant with CQC Regulation 9 (Person-centred care). Reviews assessment, consent, and review processes.

sections.title: 1. Personal Details & Consent
items: Is the resident's preferred name and life history recorded?
Is there evidence of consent to care and treatment (signed by resident or best interest decision)?
Are Next of Kin / Power of Attorney details current?
Is the DNACPR status clearly documented and valid?

sections.title: 2. Assessment of Needs
items: Are baseline assessments completed (MUST, Waterlow, Falls Risk, Moving & Handling)?
Are assessments reviewed monthly or when needs change?
Do assessments clearly identify risks and control measures?

sections.title: 3. Care Planning
items: Are care plans written in the first person ('I prefer...')?
Do care plans address all identified needs (e.g., mobility, nutrition, communication)?
Are goals specific, measurable, and realistic?
Is there evidence of resident/family involvement in care planning?

sections.title: 4. Review & Evaluation
items: Are monthly reviews completed and meaningful (not just 'no change')?
Do daily notes reflect the care plan interventions?
Has the care plan been updated following any incidents or hospital admissions?

templates.title: Staff Feedback & Satisfaction Survey
templates.description: A confidential survey to gather staff views on leadership, support, and safety culture. Supports CQC Regulation 17 (Good governance) and Well-led key question.

sections.title: 1. Leadership & Support
items: Do you feel supported by the management team?
Are you comfortable raising concerns about care quality or safety?
Do you receive regular supervision and appraisals?
Is communication from management clear and timely?

sections.title: 2. Training & Development
items: Do you feel you have the necessary training to do your job effectively?
Are you given opportunities for professional development?
Is the induction process for new staff effective?

sections.title: 3. Work Environment & Safety
items: Do you have access to the equipment you need (e.g., hoists, PPE)?
Is the staffing level adequate to meet residents' needs?
Do you feel safe at work?
Are you aware of the whistleblowing policy?

sections.title: 4. General Satisfaction
items: Would you recommend this home as a place to work?
Would you recommend this home to a friend or relative for care?
What is one thing we could do to improve?

templates.title: CQC Inspection Readiness Checklist
templates.description: A master checklist to prepare for a CQC inspection. Covers the 5 Key Questions (Safe, Effective, Caring, Responsive, Well-led) and essential evidence gathering.

sections.title: 1. Safe
items: Are safeguarding logs up-to-date and notifications sent to CQC?
Are staffing rotas available for the last 3 months?
Are recruitment files complete (DBS, references, gaps in employment)?
Are building safety certificates current (Gas, Fire, Legionella, Electrical)?

sections.title: 2. Effective
items: Are staff training matrices up-to-date (mandatory training)?
Are DoLS applications and authorisations recorded?
Are dietary needs and fluid charts being monitored effectively?
Is there evidence of multi-disciplinary team (MDT) involvement?

sections.title: 3. Caring
items: Are residents treated with dignity and respect (observations)?
Are resident meetings held regularly and minutes available?
Is there a compliment folder available for inspection?
Are privacy screens/curtains used appropriately?

sections.title: 4. Responsive
items: Is the complaints procedure displayed and accessible?
Are complaints investigated and responded to within timeframes?
Are activities schedules displayed and evidence of participation recorded?
Are end-of-life care plans in place where appropriate?

sections.title: 5. Well-led
items: Is the Statement of Purpose up-to-date?
Are quality assurance audits completed and actions tracked?
Is the Registered Manager in post and visible?
Are policies and procedures reviewed annually?
